verses.roman:
eka-i vigraha kintu ākāre haya āna
aneka prakāśa haya, 'vilāsa' tāra nāma

synonyms: eka-i—one; vigraha—form; kintu—but; ākāre—in appearance; haya—is; āna—different; aneka—many; prakāśa—manifestations; haya—appear; vilāsa—pastime form; tāra—of that; nāma—the name.
translation: But when the numerous forms are slightly different from one another, they are called vilāsa-vigrahas.
